page.title: 01Lower Rochford & Teme Valley
page.content: The esignate area includes parts of four parishes. Burford (Salop) Boraston (Salop) Knighton-on-Teme and Rochford (Heffs and Worcs) The River Teme runs through the middle the Valley contains to princile cultivated areas. Hops are grown as a main crop though on a considerably reduce scale than some 20 years ago. The bordering hillsides are primariy under grass upon which both cattle ad sheep are grazed primarily the latter. There are a ew small fruit orchads scattere over the whole area a some soft fruit is also grown. The settllements are few. Upper Rochford and Knighton bring the only significant nes. Both churches, Rochford and Knighton are apart from any settlement, though close to isolatedd buildings. The working population is roughly divided
